metadata.title: CVE-2024-50033 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:slip: make slhc_remember() more robust against malicious packetssyzbot found that slhc_remember() was missing checks againstmalicious packets [1].slhc_remember() only checked the size of the packet was at least 20,which is not good enough.We need to make sure the packet includes the IPv4 and TCP headerthat are supposed to be carried.Add iph and th pointers to make the code more readable.[1]BUG: KMSAN: uninit-value in slhc_remember+0x2e8/0x7b0drivers/net/slip/slhc.c:666  slhc_remember+0x2e8/0x7b0
